wikipedia_page.main: Glen Ronald Mitchell (born 11 May 1958) is a retired British cyclist. He competed in the team pursuit event at the 1980 Summer Olympics.

Glen Mitchell may refer to:
* Glen Mitchell (British cyclist) (born 1958), Olympic cyclist for Great Britain
* Glen Mitchell (New Zealand cyclist) (born 1972), Olympic cyclist for New Zealand
* Glen Mitchell House, house in Dodge City, Kansas, United States
|Glen Mitchell ||scratch race, team pursuit||1 x bronze

He represented England in the 10 miles scratch race, the 1 Km time trial and the 4,000 metres team pursuit, at the 1978 Commonwealth Games in Edmonton, Alberta, Canada and was part of the bronze medal pursuit winning team that consisted of Tony James, Tony Doyle and Glen Mitchell.

He represented England in the 4,000 metres team pursuit, at the 1978 Commonwealth Games in Edmonton, Alberta, Canada, the team went on to win a bronze medal and consisted of Paul Fennell, Tony Doyle and Glen Mitchell.
